reviews.review_msg: Leith's powerpoints are very informative, she loves her student and I never skipped her classes cuz it was never boring.

Very passionate about what she's teaching. If you need extra help  she is approachable and available. Obviously the class is going to be a struggle if you're not a great writer. My TA was not the easiest marker- although its hard to say since we've only gotten back one assignment at this point.

I don't know where some people are saying her notes sucked. While they don't really seem very inspiring at first, they were good enough for me to write a short essay on the final about a book I didn't even touch during that class. Tons of reading, you need to keep it up. Other than that, not a bad class.

kate is RAD.  although fast paced, her lecture style is concise, yet informative.  you can afford to miss a lecture at times, her notes make it easy to catch up. no help writing an essay? BS! she spent an entire lecture on HOW TO, you fools. plus the time she spends explaining style, message, form, etc. of each reading. does it get any simpler?

She is very nice and accomadating. She makes an extra effort to help her students excel. Her lectures make reading the books almost pointless. She is a fair marker. But it was kind of interesting that all the literature discussed in class was either feminist, anti-war or anti-business.
Found her kind of annoying.  I got an A though so I'm not complaining.
No Comments
Paul is a great professor. Interesting course and I would recommend any course with this prof! Going to class was not mandatory as everything he showed was on the class website

Paul's chosen course material (especially the final book, Gender Trouble) was far too advanced for a first year class. A book like Gender Trouble is a 3rd year book (at minimum) and should not be given to first years, especially in first year W course where a good number of students may not even have English as their first language. nice guy though

If you're taking the course to learn more about writing or because you're interested in prose, look elsewhere. I just skipped the last few lectures because all he did was talk about social justice related topics that had little (read: nothing) to do with rhetoric or writing. Very boring. I regret taking the class.
He is rude and pretentious. Do not take a course with this guy because the only way to get an A in this class is to write at his level.

You need to go to every lecture to understand the material because you have to apply Lacan to the textbooks. Trust me, it is not an easy parrellel. I don't think he tries to make Eng hard (but the again he wasn't my TA) but instead tries to make it have more depth. His final was very easy as he pretty much told us what was gonna be on it.

Horrible professor. His sole purpose is to make English seem like the hardest class in the University and he will do ANYTHING to achieve that purpose. Besides being an annoying and boring prof he is also an awfull TA. If you wrote your papers on B's and B+'s expect to receive D's when he marks them.
if i can, i want to make him listen to his own lectures...
Don't take a class with this prof. He is an unorganized jerk.
Great Prof. Very interesting and keeps lectures interesting. Would take another English course with him!

Enjoy going to class and listening to his rants. Takes a 'tough coach' method to teaching and although some material is hard to get through, the class itself is interesting and made me want to take another english course with him!

He is really funny, but I do not really get much out of the class... yes he goes over the books, but I feel like I will have no use for what he tells me... Still, not a bad class, and I actually do not mind attending.
Fun to listen too, as long as your not LATE.

Ogden is rigorous & demanding, but a good Prof. Class assignments were easy for me because essay writing is a strength of mine, but I can see how others may struggle. Lectures are fairly entertaining, especially considering the subject. Final is going to be tough though!

The worst prof I've ever had (and I've had A LOT of profs!)...she made a girl cry during a presentation!  She is obviously very bitter and talks down to everyone.  You try your hardest to please her, but get walked all over anyway.
not pleasant or personable, really boring lectures.
No Comments
way too focused on politics rather than literature
bad boring lectures.. stupid.. not helpful
ummmmm...worse eng teacher ever...i don't even remember how many times i've fallen asleep in her class...so boring and useless
She needs to take public speaking class.  I stopped going to lecture (as did half the class) because I couldn't handle listening to her say UM any more.  I would never take her again.
This is a reallly good professor. She expains things very well and makes reading a better experience.
She's damn fine, but i cnat write an essay to save my life

he's easy going/nice & i find this course really interesting! not a difficult course, all u have to do is to attend lectures, write essays & study the notes... textbooks are extremely useless (i've never read a page)... lectures can be quite boring but they r helpful/clear/prepared & hint: study ALL the notes (time & date & name) & do practices
Material is interesting , but the lectures are very boring. Cramer is a nice guy but is very monotone.
